results.name: Number of n X n matrices with exactly 2 1's in each row and column, other entries 0.
comment: Or, number of labeled 2-regular relations of order n.
Also number of ways to arrange 2n rooks on an n X n chessboard, with no more than 2 rooks in each row and column (no 3 in a line). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 03 2013

Index entries for sequences related to binary matrices
formula: a(n) = (n! (n-1) Gamma(n-1/2) / Gamma(1/2) ) * 1F1[2-n; 3/2-n; -1/2] [Erlebach and Ruehr]. This representation is exact, asymptotic and convergent.
b_n = a_n/n! satisfies b_n = (n-1)(b_{n-1} + b_{n-2}/2); e.g.f. for {b_n} and for derangements (A000166) are related by D(x) = B(x)^2.
lim(n->infinity) sqrt(n)*a(n)/(n!)^2 = A096411 [Kuczma]. - _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 21 2007
mathematica: a[n_] := (n-1)*n!*Gamma[n-1/2]*Hypergeometric1F1[2-n, 3/2-n, -1/2]/Sqrt[Pi]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 17}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 06 2011, after first formula *)
